moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 d4 4. Nf3 Nc6 5. Nbd2
comment: #Normal here is 5 g3,but the game soon transposes.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 d4 4. Nf3 Nc6 5. Nbd2 f6
comment:
5...f6 is an
attempt to play the game as a "pure"gambit Alternatives for Black involve
playing the White squared Bishop to g4 or e6, the Queen to d7and o-o-o 
swapping off the Bishops once White has played g3 and Bg2,also in recent years
castling short and playing the game positionally has become popular!

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 d4 4. Nf3 Nc6 5. Nbd2 f6 6. exf6 Nxf6 7. g3 Bg4 8. a3 Qe7
comment:
Normal would be 8...Qd7 as mentioned The text is an
idea of Nikolay Minev in Inside Chess I'm following the game Lignell-Niemela
1941.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 d4 4. Nf3 Nc6 5. Nbd2 f6 6. exf6 Nxf6 7. g3 Bg4 8. a3 Qe7 9. Bg2 d3 10. e3 Nd4 11. O-O
comment: 11 h3 was obligatory according to Minev.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 d4 4. Nf3 Nc6 5. Nbd2 f6 6. exf6 Nxf6 7. g3 Bg4 8. a3 Qe7 9. Bg2 d3 10. e3 Nd4 11. O-O Ne2+ 12. Kh1 O-O-O 13. Qa4
comment: 13 b4 was played in the above mentioned game (if 13 h3  h5! )I'm now on my own!

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 d4 4. Nf3 Nc6 5. Nbd2 f6 6. exf6 Nxf6 7. g3 Bg4 8. a3 Qe7 9. Bg2 d3 10. e3 Nd4 11. O-O Ne2+ 12. Kh1 O-O-O 13. Qa4 Kb8 14. b4 h5 15. Bb2 h4 16. Nxh4 Bd7 17. Qa5 Ng4 18. Ndf3 Qe8 19. Ne5
comment: #19 Qg5 wth the idea of 20 Qg6!?

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 d4 4. Nf3 Nc6 5. Nbd2 f6 6. exf6 Nxf6 7. g3 Bg4 8. a3 Qe7 9. Bg2 d3 10. e3 Nd4 11. O-O Ne2+ 12. Kh1 O-O-O 13. Qa4 Kb8 14. b4 h5 15. Bb2 h4 16. Nxh4 Bd7 17. Qa5 Ng4 18. Ndf3 Qe8 19. Ne5 Rh5 20. Nxd7+ Rxd7 21. Qa4 g5
comment:
For me it is "all or nothing" in this position It is difficult to say what the
alternatives are.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 d4 4. Nf3 Nc6 5. Nbd2 f6 6. exf6 Nxf6 7. g3 Bg4 8. a3 Qe7 9. Bg2 d3 10. e3 Nd4 11. O-O Ne2+ 12. Kh1 O-O-O 13. Qa4 Kb8 14. b4 h5 15. Bb2 h4 16. Nxh4 Bd7 17. Qa5 Ng4 18. Ndf3 Qe8 19. Ne5 Rh5 20. Nxd7+ Rxd7 21. Qa4 g5 22. Bf3 Qe6 23. Kg2
comment:
The game now swings in Black's
favour Possibly 23 Qb5 to bring the Queen into the game would be better.

#This is probably the decisive mistake At this point the game was finely
balanced  31 c5!? looks better.

Kf1 Rxf5+ 34. Bxf5 Bg3
comment:
In a lot of lines in the Albin White's Queen goes to a4 to
pressure Black's queenside In this instance it was his undoing as it remained
out of the game The back rank threat was an allusion!
